concepts.name: Cognitive frailty
concepts.description: A multidimensional geriatric syndrome characterized by combined physical and cognitive decline, measured through cognitive tests like MMSE and working memory tasks. Central to the study's focus on age-related functional deterioration in immigrant populations.

concepts.name: Circadian rhythm disruption
concepts.description: Abnormalities in the 24-hour biological sleep-wake cycle, assessed via actigraphy and sleep diaries. Key predictor of cognitive and physical decline in the study's mediation model for zero-generation immigrants.

concepts.name: Cultural adaptation stress
concepts.description: Psychosocial burden from navigating cultural differences in a new country, measured through multidimensional questionnaires. Identified as the critical mediator linking sleep/circadian issues to frailty outcomes.

concepts.name: Zero-generation immigrants
concepts.description: First-generation Chinese immigrants (parents of U.S.-born children) who migrated as adults. Defined as the primary study population experiencing heightened health disparities compared to first-generation descendants.

concepts.name: Physical frailty
concepts.description: Age-related decline in physiological reserve, quantified through grip strength and gait speed assessments. Directly correlated with sleep disruption and cultural stress in the study's outcomes.

methods.name: Actigraphy monitoring
methods.description: Objective sleep assessment using wearable activity trackers recording movement patterns over 10 days to quantify sleep duration, fragmentation, and circadian rhythm stability.

methods.name: 10-day sleep diaries
methods.description: Self-reported sleep logs documenting bedtime, wake time, and daytime sleepiness, used alongside actigraphy to validate subjective sleep experiences and identify circadian misalignment.

methods.name: MMSE cognitive assessment
methods.description: Standardized Mini-Mental State Examination administered to measure global cognitive function, serving as the primary outcome for cognitive frailty evaluation in the study.

methods.name: Frailty assessment protocol
methods.description: Multidimensional frailty evaluation using grip strength (handheld dynamometer) and gait speed (4-meter walk test) to quantify physical decline, aligned with Fried frailty criteria.

methods.name: Mediation analysis
methods.description: Statistical technique (e.g., PROCESS macro) testing cultural adaptation stress as a mediator between sleep/circadian variables and frailty outcomes, using path coefficients to quantify indirect effects.

methods.name: Observational cohort design
methods.description: Cross-sectional study recruiting 200 participants stratified by immigration generation and sex, collecting data through standardized instruments without intervention to establish associations.
